intro: Berkheya pinnatifida subsp. stobaeoides, commonly known as the Cape buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and is well adapted to arid conditions. It has a short stature, often reaching only a few centimeters in height, and produces small, seed-like fruits. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
